content:
The Joan MacDonald of the Langsam Family


Date: Sat, 19 Jan 2002 23:44:50 -0500
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Langsam Family
Bcc: jelangsam@yahoo.com, mailto:malangsam@anl.gov, mailto:sstev97560@aol.com, 

Hi, 

I am an amateur genealogist researching my family history. Pesach Langsam (1748 - 1820) 
had several children, the oldest one never having adopted the surname LANGSAM (but rather 
Miller, from whom I descend). 

Would you perhaps be interested in exploring a possible connection to the original Pesach 
Langsam? I have a website with a fair amount of detail on his descendents. It is at 
www.langsam.com

I look forward to your response. 

-Moishe Miller 
moishe@langsam.com

_________________________________________________________________________
Date: Wed, 23 Jan 2002 13:23:40 -0800 (PST) 
From: Joan MacDonald  
Subject: Re: Langsam Family 
To: "moishe@langsam.com"  


Hi,  I would find it interesting as I am technically
the last "langsam" in my family line.  

Joan Langsam

_________________________________________________________________________
Date: Wed, 23 Jan 2002 22:14:05 -0500
To: Joan MacDonald 
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Re: Langsam Family

Hi,

Thanks for your response. Please tell me about your ancestry so that I might 
place you within the existing tree.

-Moishe
_________________________________________________________________________
Date: Fri, 3 May 2002 16:01:14 -0700 (PDT) 
From: Joan MacDonald  
Subject: Re: Langsam Family 
To: "moishe@langsam.com"  


Unfortunately I don't know that much.  I am trying to
find out.  I know that my grandfather Langsam came
here from Poland in the late 1800's.  I will try to
find out more.  Joan Langsam


I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.

Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

Last updated 6/24/04
